alert.note: Alert for Monroe (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 27 at 10:20AM CDT until March 29 at 1:32PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 130 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of south central Alabama and southwest Alabama, including the following counties, in south central Alabama, Conecuh and Monroe. In southwest Alabama, Clarke. * WHEN...Until 130 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1020 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Monroeville, Jackson, Evergreen, Frisco City, Peterman, Excel, Repton, I65 And US 84, Mexboro, Mexia Crossing, Mexia, Ollie, West Monroeville, Manistee, Perdue Hill, Megargel, Hixon, Halls Crossroads, Claiborne and Monroeton.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
